meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of demons.
meanings.sent1: The dark, demonical figure haunted the old castle.
meanings.sent2: The spooky forest had a demonical atmosphere at night.
meanings.sent3: The demonical laugh echoed through the haunted house.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a demonical glint as she told the scary story.
meanings.sent5: The demonical presence sent shivers down their spines.

meanings.definition: Possessed or influenced by a demon.
meanings.sent1: The possessed girl displayed demonical behavior during the exorcism.
meanings.sent2: The demonical voice spoke through the medium at the seance.
meanings.sent3: The demonical possession made the cat act strangely.
meanings.sent4: His demonical rage was uncontrollable when he was angry.
meanings.sent5: The demonical influence seemed to grow stronger with each passing day.

meanings.definition: Resembling or suggestive of a demon.
meanings.sent1: The mask had a demonical look that scared the children.
meanings.sent2: The shadows cast by the fire created a demonical silhouette on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The demonical costume won first prize at the Halloween party.
meanings.sent4: Her demonical grin made her seem mischievous.
meanings.sent5: The demonical horns added an eerie touch to his costume.
